title: Ace Attorney Guide
description: Guide website made to easily access 'Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney' Series guides from StrategyWiki.
markdown:
## Overview

A **lightweight, fast-access guide website** for the Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney game series, solving the navigation pain point of existing wikis. Built using **mdBook** (Rust-based static site generator), the project transforms StrategyWiki's comprehensive game guides into an instantly accessible reference with direct deep-linking to specific game chapters, cases, and walkthroughs.

**Problem Solved:** Players frequently need quick access to specific game sections (e.g., "Case 3, Investigation Day 2"), but navigating traditional wiki hierarchies is time-consuming during active gameplay. This tool provides **one-click access** to any game segment.

## Technical Approach

### Architecture

**Stack:**
- **mdBook:** Rust-powered static site generator optimized for documentation/book-style content
- **Markdown:** All content authored in plain Markdown for version control and easy contributions
- **GitHub Pages:** Zero-cost static hosting with automatic deployment
- **Mobile-First Design:** Responsive layout for on-the-go gameplay reference

### Implementation Details

**Content Organization:**
- **Main Series:** 6 mainline Phoenix Wright games (PWAA 1-3, Apollo Justice, Dual Destinies, Spirit of Justice)
- **Spin-offs:** Ace Attorney Investigations series, Great Ace Attorney Chronicles
- **Crossovers:** Professor Layton vs. Phoenix Wright
- **Deep Linking:** Direct URLs to specific cases/chapters within each game guide

**Build Pipeline:**
```bash
# Development workflow
mdbook serve --open  # Live reload dev server

# Production build
mdbook build  # Generates static HTML in /book directory
```

**Deployment:**
- **Version Control:** GitHub repository with Markdown source
- **CI/CD:** Automatic deployment via Railway/GitHub Pages on push
- **Mobile Testing:** Used ngrok for localhost forwarding during mobile UI development

### Design Principles

1. **Speed:** Static site = instant page loads, no server processing
2. **Simplicity:** Pure Markdown â†’ HTML, no complex frontend framework overhead
3. **Accessibility:** Clean URL structure for bookmarking specific game sections
4. **Maintainability:** Community contributions via GitHub pull requests

## Challenges & Solutions

| Challenge | Solution |
|-----------|----------|
| **Wiki navigation friction** | Created flat, hierarchical link structure with direct game/case/chapter access |
| **Mobile usability** | Leveraged mdBook's responsive themes; tested with ngrok port forwarding for real device testing |
| **Content maintenance** | Markdown source control enables community PRs; mdBook rebuild is instant |
| **Discoverability** | Added play order chart (credited to Reddit community) for newcomers to the series |
| **Cross-platform development** | Rust toolchain ensures consistent builds across Windows/macOS/Linux |
